hero.title: Cultivating Connections, Harvesting Prosperity
hero.subtitle: We are on a mission to digitize and connect the global agricultural supply chain, empowering every stakeholder from soil to shelf.

vision.title: Our Vision for a Connected Future
vision.p1: DamDoh was born from a simple yet powerful idea: that technology can bridge the gaps in the world of agriculture. We envision a world where smallholder farmers have direct access to global markets, where buyers can source products with provable trust, and where knowledge flows freely to create a more sustainable and equitable food system.
vision.p2: We're more than just a platform; we are a community dedicated to solving real-world challenges with innovative, user-centric solutions.

challenge.title: The Fragmented Landscape of Agriculture
challenge.description: The agricultural supply chain is a complex web of disconnected systems, creating systemic inefficiencies that impact everyone from producer to consumer.
details: Smallholder farmers are often disconnected from larger, more profitable national and international markets.
Disjointed logistics, from aggregation to last-mile delivery, result in high costs and significant delays.
A lack of formalized financial records prevents millions of farmers from accessing credit, loans, and insurance.
Farmers often lack access to timely market data, advanced agronomy, and sustainable best practices.
Buyers cannot easily verify the origin, quality, or sustainable practices of the products they source.
Increasingly unpredictable weather patterns demand more resilient and adaptive agricultural systems.
Inadequate storage and transport infrastructure lead to a significant portion of produce spoiling before it reaches the consumer.
Information is trapped in silos (paper logs, different apps, etc.), making it impossible to get a complete view of the supply chain.

solution.title: The DamDoh Solution: An Integrated Ecosystem
solution.description: We address these challenges by providing a single, unified platform with tools for everyone.

p2p.title: Peer-to-Peer
p2p.content: Connecting farmers to other farmers to share knowledge and form cooperatives.

p2b.title: Producer-to-Business
p2b.content: Fostering direct, trusted relationships between producers and buyers, processors, and exporters.

p2e.title: Producer-to-Ecosystem
p2e.content: Giving individuals access to an entire ecosystem of services - finance, logistics, insurance, and more.

p2w.title: Producer-to-World
p2w.content: Enabling smallholder farmers to participate in the global market with confidence and transparency.

commitment.title: Join Our Growing Ecosystem
commitment.p1: Our commitment is to the people who feed the world. We believe that by providing the digital tools they need, we can foster a more resilient, profitable, and sustainable agricultural sector for generations to come.
commitment.p2: Whether you are planting a seed, buying in bulk, or financing a farm, you have a place in the DamDoh community.

contactPage.title: Contact Us
contactPage.subtitle: We're here to help. Reach out to us through any of the channels below.

sendMessage.title: Send Us a Message
sendMessage.note: We strive to respond within 24 business hours.

careers.title: Careers at DamDoh
careers.subtitle: Join our mission to revolutionize the agricultural supply chain.

whyWorkWithUs.title: Why Work With Us?
whyWorkWithUs.intro: At DamDoh, we are a team of passionate innovators, technologists, and agricultural experts dedicated to creating tangible global impact. We offer:
whyWorkWithUs.point2: Opportunities for professional growth and learning.
whyWorkWithUs.point3: A culture of collaboration and transparency.
whyWorkWithUs.point4: The chance to work with cutting-edge technologies like AI and blockchain.
whyWorkWithUs.point5: A commitment to sustainability and social impact.

job1.title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer (Next.js, Firebase)
job1.description: We are seeking an experienced full-stack engineer to lead development on our platform's core features.

job2.title: Agronomy Content Specialist
job2.description: Help us build the world's most comprehensive knowledge base for sustainable farming practices.

job3.title: UX/UI Designer
job3.description: Design intuitive and accessible user experiences for a diverse, global user base.

noOpenings.title: No Current Openings
noOpenings.content1: We are always looking for talented individuals who are passionate about our mission. If you think you'd be a great fit for our team, please send your resume and cover letter to {emailLink}.

communityGuidelines.title: Community Guidelines
communityGuidelines.subtitle: Fostering a professional, trustworthy, and collaborative environment.
communityGuidelines.intro: Welcome to the DamDoh community! Our mission is to connect the world of agriculture in a positive and productive way. To ensure everyone has a great experience, we ask that you adhere to the following guidelines:

respectful.title: Be Respectful and Professional
respectful.description: Engage in civil, constructive discussions. Disagreements are normal, but personal attacks, harassment, and hate speech are unacceptable.

authentic.title: Be Honest and Authentic
authentic.description: Represent yourself and your business accurately. Do not impersonate others or provide false information about your products, services, or certifications.

relevant.title: Stay Relevant
relevant.description: Contribute to discussions and listings in a way that is relevant to the agricultural supply chain. Spam, scams, and irrelevant promotional content will be removed.

fairTrade.title: Honor Your Commitments
fairTrade.description: When you make an agreement on the platform, follow through. Building trust is essential to our community's success.

sustainable.title: Promote Sustainability
sustainable.description: While not a strict requirement for all members, we encourage the sharing of knowledge and practices that promote environmental, economic, and social sustainability.

reporting.title: Reporting Violations
reporting.content: If you see content or behavior that violates these guidelines, please report it to our team at {emailLink}. We will review all reports and take appropriate action.

communityGuidelines.conclusion: By using DamDoh, you agree to these guidelines. We reserve the right to remove content and suspend accounts that violate these principles. Thank you for helping us build a great community!

news1.title: Global Coffee Prices Surge Amidst Climate Concerns in Key Growing Regions
news1.excerpt: Arabica coffee futures have hit an 18-month high as droughts in Brazil and unexpected frosts in Vietnam threaten global supply.

news2.title: EU Implements New 'Farm to Fork' Packaging Regulations
news2.excerpt: New regulations coming into effect this quarter will require all fresh produce imported into the European Union to use packaging made from at least 30% recycled materials.

news3.title: Study Shows Regenerative Farming Practices Can Sequester Up to 2 Tons of Carbon Per Hectare Annually
news3.excerpt: A decade-long study published in 'Nature Sustainability' provides compelling evidence that no-till farming and cover cropping significantly improve soil carbon levels.

knfOptions.placeholder: e.g. Sweet potato tips, bamboo shoots

knfOptions.label: Indigenous Microorganisms (IMO)
knfOptions.placeholder: e.g. Cooked rice, local forest soil

recipeData.name: Fermented Plant Juice (FPJ)
recipeData.description: A potent growth enhancer made from the fermented sap of fast-growing plants. Rich in enzymes and microorganisms.
ingredients: 1kg of fast-growing plant parts (e.g., sweet potato tips, bamboo shoots)
steps: Collect plant materials before sunrise. Do not wash.
Mix with an equal weight of brown sugar.
Pack tightly into a breathable container, 2/3 full.
Cover with cloth, store in a cool, dark place for ~7 days.
recipeData.usage: Dilution rate: 1:500 to 1:1000 with water. Apply as foliar spray or soil drench.

recipeData.name: Fish Amino Acid (FAA)
recipeData.description: A nitrogen-rich fertilizer made from fermented fish parts, excellent for vegetative growth.
steps: Layer the fish and brown sugar in a container (2/3 full).
Cover and let it ferment for at least 3-6 months in a cool, dark place.
recipeData.usage: Dilution rate: 1:1000 with water. Primarily used for soil drenching.
